summary: Provides an MXNet implementation of the NNConv graph convolution layer, which transforms edge features into weight matrices via a user-defined function, applies these weights to source node features, aggregates messages (sum, mean, or max), and optionally adds residual connections and bias, supporting both homogeneous and bipartite graph structures.
business_intent: Enable developers to incorporate edge‑conditioned graph convolution operations into MXNet‑based deep learning pipelines for tasks such as node classification, link prediction, and graph‑level prediction across various domains.
